column4: Can debian deb packages be used for ubuntu as on line install ?
yes
most packages available for debian are also available for ubuntu.
I can help you with that if you like
are you using Warty or Hoary?
this is a good starting point: http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/GuideToHoary/
you may want to uncomment the lines with universe and multiverse to get access to the largest set of available software for ubuntu
the packaging format?
if you're looking for documentation on how to use apt, you can install the apt-howto package
not the whole line.  Just remove the "#"
so the first character on the line is "d" (part of the word deb)
you'll need to do an update after you finish editing that file
are you asking what I do personally, or what can one do in general?
the short answer is scientific computing, as well as everyday desktop usage
the sky's the limit :)
yep
were you able to find the software you're looking for after adding universe and multiverse?
yes.  Is that what you were looking for?
if you're interested in kubuntu, have you seen this: http://www.kubuntu.org.uk/index.php ?
of course :)
it's possible, but not really recommended, to install ubuntu over a debian base installation
you could install kubuntu if you prefer KDE
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wiki
okay, it's entirely up to you :)
